summary: David Tennant’s podcast with Michael Sheen
title: David Tennant’s podcast with Michael Sheen
body:
Michael Sheen: Eventually he [Neil Gaiman] sent me one of the scripts, an early draft for like the first episode of Good Omens, and we started talking about me being involved and doing it - he said ‘Would you be interested?’ and I said ‘Yeah, of course, oh my god!’ and he said ‘Well, I’ll send you the scripts when they come…’ and I would read them and we’d talk about them a little bit - so I was sort of involved. 

But it was always at that point, ‘cause he’d always said about playing Crowley in it. And as time went on, as I was reading the scripts, I was thinking: I don’t think I can play Crowley, I don’t think I’m goint to be able to do it. And I’d start to get a bit nervous ‘cause I don’t want to tell Neil that I don’t think I can do this but I just felt I don’t think I can play Crowley. 

David Tennant: Of course you could. 

Michael Sheen: Just, on a sort of gut level - you now sometimes on a gut level you feel ‘I can do this or I can’t do this’. And I just thought: You know what, this is just not the part for me, the other part is better for me, I think. I think I can do that, I don’t think I can do that. But I was scared to tell Neil, ‘cause I thought: Well he wants me to play Crowley. And it turned out he had been feeling the same way, and he hadn’t wanted to mention it to me but he was like ‘I think Michael should really play Aziraphale’. And neither of us would bring it up, and then eventually we did and it was one of those things where you go, ‘Oh thank God you said that, I feel exactly the same way!’ 

And then I think that within a fairly short space of time, he said, ‘I think we’ve got David Tennant for Crowley’. And we both got very excited about that, and then all these extraordinary people started joining in.

…

Michael Sheen: This is the only thing I’ve done where I really don’t think of it as ‘my character’ or ‘my performance’, I think of it totallly as ‘us’, ‘the two of us’. What I do is defined by what you do.

You can listen to the podcast here. :)

Michael Sheen joins David this week to talk Good Omens, becoming Tony Blair, and how he returned home to Port Talbot.

Listen now on Apple Podcasts, Spotify or wherever you get your podcasts from:

summary:
Listen Now To David Tennant Does A Podcast With... Michael Sheen  

A new episode of David Tennant’s podcast series David...
caption:
Listen Now To David Tennant Does A Podcast With… Michael Sheen 

A new episode of David Tennant’s podcast series David Tennant Does A Podcast With… is now live. This week David’s guest is his Good Omens co star, the actor Michael Sheen who talks about becoming Brian Clough, Tony Blair and most recently Aziraphale, how early criticism helped shape his career and how he found his way home to Port Talbot.

Continue reading

blog.name: curiouslissa
blog.title: These fragments I have shored against my ruins
blog.description:
Some fandom stuff and occasional fanart.
Welcome!

tags: david tennant does a podcast with
i want to have this here
summary: There is a bit in "The Waste Land", there is a line which goes:
body:
There is a bit in “The Waste Land”, there is a line which goes:

“These fragments I have shored against my ruin”.

And this is how I think about life now. There is so much in life. No matter what your circumstances is. No matter where you go, what you’ve done, how much money have you got. Life is hard. And it can take you down at any point. You have to find this stuff. You have to find things, these fragments that you hold to yourself. They’ll become like a life raft. And especially as time goes on, when I got older, I realised:

There is a thin line between surviving this life and going under. And the things that keep you afloat are these fragments, these things that are meaningful to you. And what’s meaningful to you, will be not meaningful to someone else. But whatever it is that matters to you. It does not matter what it was you were into when you were a teenager, a kid. Doesn’t matter what it is. Go and find them! And find some way to hold them close to you. Go and get it! Because those are the things that keep you afloat. They really are. Like doing that with him or… Whatever it is. These are the fragments that I’ve shored against my ruin. Absolutely.

© Michael Sheen from today’s episode of David Tennant’s podcast

blog.name: tinsnip
blog.title: No, said Aziraphale, it's ineffable.
blog.description:
Hello, I'm tinsnip.

Feeling rather ineffable these days. Expect a great deal of Good Omens.

Other interests: Star Trek. (Primarily DS9 and Cardassians.)
Pratchett. Wodehouse.
Cats. The Doctors Whom. Science. Cute things. Life truths. Pixels. And spiders, sometimes, so keep that in mind.

I post fic on AO3. It's quite good - you should have a look.

My work with Vyc on a Kardasi conlang is here.

Cardassian meta is found mostly under cardassians or kardasi.

If you enjoy my fanfic, why not buy me a coffee?

summary: Michael Sheen: “It was easier for me because I decided that early on that Aziraphale just loves Crowley. And that’s difficult...
text:
Michael Sheen: “It was easier for me because I decided that early on that Aziraphale just loves Crowley. And that’s difficult for him because they’re on opposite sides and he doesn’t agree with him on stuff. But it does really help as an actor to go, ‘My objective in this scene is to not show you how much I love you. And just gaze longingly at you all the time.’ That really does happen.”

David Tennant: “But then Crowley absolutely loves Aziraphale. He hates that he loves him. It’s really annoying for him. So, they’re both going through that.”


Michael Sheen: “There is a sort of wonderful love story in this. I think a lot of the fans of the book kind of like that when they think about the characters, there’s an interesting love story going on. It’s never explicit in this, but it’s there. It is there.”
source:
Showbiz Junkies: ‘Good Omens’ – Michael Sheen and David Tennant Interview on Starring in the Adaptation of Neil Gaiman’s Book

There are no words for how happy this makes me. Michael and David get it.

reblog.comment:
Showbiz Junkies: ‘Good Omens’ – Michael Sheen and David Tennant Interview on Starring in the Adaptation of Neil Gaiman’s Book
